description.narrative: For this project CDPF has chosen two Millennium Development Goals to trace their inclusion in the Yemeni public budget One is the MDG number 4: to decrease the mortality rate of children and the other is the MDG number 5: to decrease the mortality rate of mothers. These goals were chosen to serve as a non-threatening platform for the action but the expected results should encompass all issuesrelated to public budget policies and transparency practices. CDPF wants to realise the following results: - The creation of an active national CSO Budget Monitoring Network - “RASEED” - consisting of 25 CSOs from 3 governorates) that will hold local authoritiesaccountable for service delivery and will be monitoring budgetary priorities especially with regard to child and maternal mortalityrates. - The realisation of awareness raising activities with regard to the urgency to prioritize public budget allocation towards the achievement of the MDG’s among public budget policy makers to realise a reduction in child and maternal mortality rates. - The realisation of awareness raising activities to enhance human rights based budgets among governmental financial officials. - The realisation of activities to raise the sensitivity to gender issues among governmental financial officials. - 75 Participants from CSOs will be better able to understand the public budget process and terminology. They will also be equipped to pursue more detailed information, and will be enticed to gain the required skills and capacity for meaningful and capable budget monitoring work. - 50 Journalists will trained on effective budget monitoring and investigative media reporting techniques; the trained journalists will be more able to comprehend, evaluate and monitor the budgetary issues.

participating-org.narrative: The Cultural Development Programs Foundation (CDPF) was founded in 1995 and aims at increasing cultural awareness and promoting theexchange between culture and development. It considers culture to be a basic need for development. The CDPF seeks to promote and highlight the dynamics of culture within the development process toward equal citizenship and democracy. CDPF defines itself as a value-based organization that is part of Yemeni civil society. Throughout the period 2006-2013, CDPF worked with several NGOs and supported entities of the Yemen government National budget with regard to the application of international standards on transparency in the budget and the importance of reflecting MDGs in the national budget. CDPF has developed a simplified terminology dictionary for NGOs to overcome their inhibitions in dealing with what specialists in budget related issues for a long time claimed as their domain and area of expertise. The organisation also printed a time calendar of the process that the national budget passes through from themoment of its preparation to its passing to the Cabinet and the Parliament, the execution and its audit. Since 2007 CDPF has undertaken 6 projects since that adopted transparency as part of its good governance program. At that time, civil society had no idea of the linkages between the national budget and the goals or needs of civil society, particularly those related to gender. CDPF has undertaken research and collected data and information to link the national budget with gender related issues. CDPF has contributed to increasing transparency in the Yemeni budget both at the national and, more recently, at the local governance level. National and local budgets are now publicly available. CDPF has also trained NGOs as well as the government in budget and transparency related issues. CDPF has made a substantial contribution to raising the consciousness and developing a culture that connects budget transparency with the realization of human rights.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: no. of partner organisations with stronger capacity for monitoring governments and private sector on obligations and duties in their budget (income and expenditure) with specific attention to impact on women
